OptionsGroup.name: VARIOUS PREPROCESSING OPTIONS
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: directories to include in your topology. Format: -I/home/john/my_lib -I../more_lib
defines to pass to the preprocessor, default is no defines.

OptionsGroup.name: RUN CONTROL PARAMETERS
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (0) [ps] : starting time for your run (only makes sense for integrators md, sd and bd)
(0.001) [ps] : time step for integration (only makes sense for integrators md, sd and bd)
(0) : maximum number of steps to integrate
(0) : The starting step.
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: Linear(Remove center of mass translation) Angular(Remove center of mass translation and rotation around the center of mass) No(No restriction on the center of mass motion)
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (1) [steps] : frequency for center of mass motion removal
group(s) for center of mass motion removal, default is the whole system

OptionsGroup.name: LANGEVIN DYNAMICS OPTIONS
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (0) [amu ps-1] : Brownian dynamics friction coefficient. When bd_fric=0, the friction coefficient for each particle is calculated as mass/tau
(1993) [integer] : used to initialize random generator for thermal noise for stochastic and Brownian dynamics.

OptionsGroup.name: ENERGY MINIMIZATION OPTIONS
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (10.0) [kJ mol-1 nm-1] : the minimization is converged when the maximum force is smaller than this value
(0.01) [nm] : initial step-size
(1000) [steps] : frequency of performing 1 steepest descent step while doing conjugate gradient energy minimization
(10) : Number of correction steps to use for L-BFGS minimization. A higher number is (at least theoretically) more accurate, but slower.

OptionsGroup.name: Shell Molecular Dynamics
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (20) : maximum number of iterations for optimizing the shell positions and the flexible constraints.
(0) [ps2] : the step size for optimizing the flexible constraints.

OptionsGroup.name: Test particle insertion
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (0.05) [nm] : the test particle insertion radius see integrators tpi and tpic

OptionsGroup.name: OUTPUT CONTROL OPTIONS
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (100) [steps] : frequency to write coordinates to output trajectory file, the last coordinates are always written
(100) [steps] : frequency to write velocities to output trajectory, the last velocities are always written
(0) [steps] : frequency to write forces to output trajectory.
(100) [steps] : frequency to write energies to log file, the last energies are always written
(100) [steps] : frequency to write energies to energy file, the last energies are always written.
(0) [steps] : frequency to write coordinates to xtc trajectory
(1000) [real] : precision to write to xtc trajectory
group(s) to write to xtc trajectory, default the whole system is written (if nstxtcout is larger than zero)
group(s) to write to energy file

OptionsGroup.name: NEIGHBORSEARCHING PARAMETERS
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (10) [steps] : > 0(Frequency to update the neighbor list) 0(The neighbor list is only constructed once and never updated) -1(Automated update frequency)
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: grid(Make a grid in the box and only check atoms in neighboring grid cells when constructing a new neighbor list every nstlist steps) simple(Check every atom in the box when constructing a new neighbor list every nstlist steps)

xyz(Use periodic boundary conditions in all directions) no(Use no periodic boundary conditions, ignore the box, only works with ns_type=simple) xy(Use periodic boundary conditions in x and y directions only)
no(molecules are finite, fast molecular pbc can be used) yes(for systems with molecules that couple to themselves through the periodic boundary conditions)
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (1) [nm] : cut-off distance for the short-range neighbor list

OptionsGroup.name: OPTIONS FOR ELECTROSTATICS
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (0) [nm] : where to start switching the Coulomb potential
(1) [nm] : distance for the Coulomb cut-off
(1) : The relative dielectric constant. A value of 0 means infinity.
(1) : The relative dielectric constant of the reaction field. This is only used with reaction-field electrostatics. A value of 0 means infinity.

OptionsGroup.name: OPTIONS FOR VDW
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (0) [nm] : where to start switching the LJ potential
(1) [nm] : distance for the LJ or Buckingham cut-off
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: no(don't apply any correction) EnerPres(apply long range dispersion corrections for Energy and Pressure) Ener(apply long range dispersion corrections for Energy only)

OptionsGroup.name: Tables
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (1) [nm] : Extension of the non-bonded potential lookup tables beyond the largest cut-off distance.

OptionsGroup.name: Ewald
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (0.12) [nm] : The maximum grid spacing for the FFT grid when using PPPM or PME.
Highest magnitude of wave vectors in reciprocal space when using Ewald.
Highest magnitude of wave vectors in reciprocal space when using Ewald.
Highest magnitude of wave vectors in reciprocal space when using Ewald.
Interpolation order for PME. 4 equals cubic interpolation. You might try 6/8/10 when running in parallel and simultaneously decrease grid dimension.
(1e-5) : The relative strength of the Ewald-shifted direct potential at rcoulomb is given by ewald_rtol.
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: 3d(The Ewald sum is performed in all three dimensions) 3dc(The reciprocal sum is still performed in 3d, but a force and potential correction applied in the z dimension to produce a pseudo-2d summation)
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (0) : This controls the dipole correction to the Ewald summation in 3d.
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: no(Don't calculate the optimal FFT plan for the grid at startup) yes(Calculate the optimal FFT plan for the grid at startup)

OptionsGroup.name: OPTIONS FOR Temperature coupling
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: groups to couple separately to temperature bath
[ps] : time constant for coupling (one for each group in tc_grps), 0 means no temperature coupling
[K] : reference temperature for coupling (one for each group in tc_grps)

OptionsGroup.name: OPTIONS FOR Pressure coupling
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: no(No pressure coupling. This means a fixed box size) berendsen(Exponential relaxation pressure coupling with time constant tau_p [ps]) Parrinello-Rahman(Extended-ensemble pressure coupling where the box vectors are subject to an equation of motion)
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (1) [ps] : time constant for coupling
[bar-1] : For water at 1 atm and 300 K the compressibility is 4.5e-5 [bar-1].
[bar] : reference pressure for coupling

OptionsGroup.name: SIMULATED ANNEALING CONTROL
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: Type of annealing for each temperature group
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: A list with the number of annealing reference/control points used for each temperature group.
List of times at the annealing reference/control points for each group.
List of temperatures at the annealing reference/control points for each group.

OptionsGroup.name: GENERATE VELOCITIES FOR STARTUP RUN
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: no(Do not generate velocities at startup) yes(Generate velocities according to a Maxwell distribution at temperature gen_temp [K])
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (300) [K] : temperature for Maxwell distribution
(173529) [integer] : used to initialize random generator for random velocities

OptionsGroup.name: OPTIONS FOR BONDS
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: no(apply constraints to the start configuration and reset shells) yes(do not apply constraints to the start configuration and do not reset shells, useful for exact coninuation and reruns)
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (0.0001) : relative tolerance for SHAKE
(4) : Highest order in the expansion of the constraint coupling matrix.
(1) : Number of iterations to correct for rotational lengthening in LINCS.
(30) [degrees] : maximum angle that a bond can rotate before LINCS will complain
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: no(bonds are represented by a harmonic potential) yes(bonds are represented by a Morse potential)

OptionsGroup.name: Energy group exclusions
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: Pairs of energy groups for which all non-bonded interactions are excluded.

OptionsGroup.name: Walls
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: -1 (nm) : Below this distance from the wall the potential is continued linearly and thus the force is constant.
the atom type name in the force field for each wall, this allows for independent tuning of the interaction of each atomtype with the walls
[nm-3/nm-2] : the number density of the atoms for each wall for wall types 9-3 and 10-4
3 : The scaling factor for the third box vector for Ewald summation only

OptionsGroup.name: COM pulling
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (Y Y Y) : the distance components to be used with geometry distance and position
(1) [nm] : the inner radius of the cylinder for geometry cylinder
(1) [nm] : the outer radius of the cylinder for geometry cylinder
(1e-6) : the relative constraint tolerance for constraint pulling
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: no(do not modify pull_init) yes(add the COM distance of the starting conformation to pull_init)
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (10) : frequency for writing out the COMs of all the pull group
(1) : frequency for writing out the force of all the pulled group
(1) : The number of pull groups, not including the reference group.
The name of the reference group.
see pull_weights1
(0) : see pull_pbcatom1
The name of the pull group.
Optional relative weights which are multiplied with the masses of the atoms to give the total weight for the COM.
(0) : The reference atom for the treatment of periodic boundary conditions inside the group (this has no effect on the treatment of the pbc between groups).
(0.0 0.0 0.0) : The pull direction. grompp normalizes the vector.
(0.0) / (0.0 0.0 0.0) [nm] : The reference distance at t=0. This is a single value, except for geometry position which uses a vector.
(0) [nm/ps] : The rate of change of the reference position.
(0) [kJ mol-1 nm-2] / [kJ mol-1 nm-1] : The force constant.
(pull_k1) [kJ mol-1 nm-2] / [kJ mol-1 nm-1] : As pull_k1, but for state B.

OptionsGroup.name: NMR refinement stuff
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (1000) [kJ mol-1 nm-2] : force constant for distance restraints, which is multiplied by a (possibly) different factor for each restraint
(0) [ps] : time constant for distance restraints running average
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: no(no orientation restraints) yes(use orientation restraints, ensemble averaging can be performed with mdrun -multi)
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (0) [kJ mol] : force constant for orientation restraints.
(0) [ps] : time constant for orientation restraints running average
fit group for orientation restraining, for a protein backbone is a good choice
(100) [steps] : frequency to write the running time averaged and instantaneous orientations for all restraints and the molecular order tensor to the energy file

OptionsGroup.name: Free energy control stuff
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (0) : starting value for lambda
(0) : increment per time step for lambda
(0) : the soft-core parameter, a value of 0 results in linear interpolation of the LJ and Coulomb interactions
(0) : the power for lambda in the soft-core function, only the values 1 and 2 are supported
(0.3) [nm] : the soft-core sigma for particles which have a C6 or C12 parameter equal to zero
Here one can supply a molecule type (as defined in the topology) for calculating solvation or coupling free energies.
analogous to couple-lambda1, but for lambda=1

OptionsGroup.name: Non-equilibrium MD stuff
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: groups for constant acceleration
(0) [nm ps-2] : acceleration for acc_grps
Groups that are to be frozen
dimensions for which groups in freezegrps
(0 0 0 0 0 0) [nm ps-1] : The velocities of deformation for the box elements

OptionsGroup.name: Mixed quantum/classical molecular dynamics
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: no(No QM/MM) yes(Do a QM/MM simulation)
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: groups to be descibed at the QM level
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: normal(normal QM/MM) ONIOM(The interaction between the subsystem is described using the ONIOM method by Morokuma and co-workers.)
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: (RHF) : Method used to compute the energy and gradients on the QM atoms.
(STO-3G) : Basisset used to expand the electronic wavefuntion.
(1) [integer] : The multiplicity of the QMMM-grps.
(0) [integer] : The number of orbitals to be included in the active space when doing a CASSCF computation.
(0) [integer] : The number of electrons to be included in the active space when doing a CASSCF computation.
OptionsGroup.OptionChoose: no(No surface hopping) yes(Do a QM/MM MD simulation)

OptionsGroup.name: User defined thingies
OptionsGroup.OptionEnter: These you can use if you modify code.
These you can use if you modify code.
These you can use if you modify code.
These you can use if you modify code.
